benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Happy paths for single and multiple tags return 201 with a JSON array of Tag objects associated to the invoice item (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC22).

Validation/Invalid Payload: Invalid invoiceItemId format, malformed JSON, empty array, invalid tag UUIDs, extra unsupported fields, null/empty entries, and malicious payload are handled with proper 4xx responses (TC07, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC24, TC18).
Required/Optional Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 when missing) and optional X-Killbill-Reason/Comment exercised (TC06, TC03).
Resource Existence: 404 for non-existent invoice item and empty database state (TC08, TC15).
Duplicate Handling: Duplicate tag IDs in request and attempting to add an already-existing tag on the item are handled without duplication (TC13, TC20).
Large Payloads: Very large array scenario covered with expected 201 or 413 handling (TC19).
Authorization/Security: 401 when auth token missing/invalid; negative security inputs validated (TC16, TC18).
Server/Dependency Faults and Timeouts: Service unavailable and downstream dependency failures yield 503; long-running operation yields 504 (TC17, TC21, TC25).
Non-functional: Performance under load validated with acceptable response time thresholds (TC14).
gaps: 500 Internal Server Error: No scenario explicitly simulates an unexpected server-side failure (e.g., database exception) returning 500.
Content Negotiation and Headers: No assertions on response Content-Type application/json; no test for request Content-Type handling or 415 Unsupported Media Type when sending non-JSON.
Response Schema Depth: Tests don’t validate the full Tag object against #/definitions/Tag (only partial checks of tagDefinitionId/association).
Duplicate Submission (idempotency) at HTTP layer: No scenario for re-sending the exact same POST (e.g., due to network retry) to confirm no unintended duplicates and consistent status/body.
Mixed-validity payloads: No test mixing valid and invalid tagDefinitionIds in the same array to define atomic vs partial behavior and expected status code.
Non-existent but well-formed tagDefinition UUID: Distinct from invalid format—no test to verify behavior when tagDefinition UUID is syntactically valid but does not exist.
Header validation boundaries: No tests for CreatedBy/Reason/Comment value length, character set, or overly long headers causing 400.
recommendations: Add a scenario to simulate an internal server error (e.g., force a DB exception) and assert a 500 response with a diagnostic error body.
Assert Content-Type: application/json in successful responses and add a test sending an incorrect or missing request Content-Type to expect 415 Unsupported Media Type.
Add schema validation of the Tag response objects to match #/definitions/Tag (all required fields, types, and formats).
Introduce an idempotent retry scenario: send the same POST twice (with identical body) and verify no duplicate tags are created and that the response remains consistent.
Create a mixed-validity payload test (e.g., ["valid-uuid", "invalid-uuid"]) to confirm whether the API rejects the whole request (400) or supports partial success, and document the expected behavior.
Add a test for a syntactically valid but non-existent tagDefinition UUID to confirm the correct error code and message (e.g., 400 vs 404).
Include header boundary tests (very long X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment, disallowed characters) to ensure robust input validation and proper error responses.
